title: Controversy on Governor House Sindh, SC adjourns initial hearing
content:
ISLAMABAD, Nov 03 (APP): The Supreme Court’s constitutional bench on Monday issued notices to the parties concerned during the hearing of a case pertaining to the Speaker’s full access to the Governor House Sindh.

The five-member bench, headed by Justice Amin-ud-Din Khan and comprising Justice Jamal Khan Mandokhail, Justice Aqeel Ahmed Abbasi, Justice Shakeel Ahmed and Justice Aamer Farooq, took up the matter.

At the outset of the hearing, Justice Amin-ud-Din Khan addressed Governor Sindh Kamran Tessori’s counsel, suggesting, “You may sit together and resolve the matter yourselves.”

Justice Aqeel Abbasi questioned what stage of legal proceedings the matter had reached.

Advocate Abid Zuberi, representing Governor Sindh, argued that the Sindh High Court had passed its order after just one hearing without issuing notices to the parties. “We appeared on the date given by the High Court, but a decision was issued without hearing us,” he added.

During the hearing, counsel for the Speaker of the Sindh Assembly requested time, stating that the Speaker had contacted him only yesterday and he needed time to prepare.

After hearing the arguments, the court adjourned the case.
